content:
Diagnosis
	1. Left breast micropapillary carcinoma T3N2M0

	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Core biopsy left breast and axillary nodes

	Radiotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Chemotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Clinical studies
	IMPACT-BC trial registration completed today

	Current disease status
	Locally advanced disease awaiting neoadjuvant treatment

	Current issues
	None acute

	Summary of consultation
	This 48-year-old lady has recently diagnosed left breast micropapillary carcinoma. Diagnostic imaging showed 7.2cm left breast mass with multiple abnormal axillary nodes. Core biopsy confirmed micropapillary carcinoma, AR and GATA3 positive with high TIL score 60%. Staging CT and bone scan show no evidence of metastatic disease.

I have discussed at length the IMPACT-BC trial which is investigating intensified neoadjuvant chemotherapy in high-risk early breast cancer. [redacted name] meets all eligibility criteria including adequate cardiac function (LVEF 62%) and normal baseline blood parameters. We reviewed the trial schema, randomisation process, and additional trial-specific requirements including research biopsies and more frequent cardiac monitoring.

She has good understanding of the trial aims and additional procedures required. Written informed consent obtained today following full discussion of alternative standard treatment options.

	Further investigations
	Baseline cardiac MRI scheduled 22 Apr 2024
	Research tissue collection 25 Apr 2024

	Medication prescribed
	None

	Follow up
	Trial randomisation 26 Apr 2024
	Chemotherapy teaching 29 Apr 2024
	First treatment scheduled 2 May 2024

	Required GP actions
	None

	Summary of information given to patient
	Full trial information provided including written materials
Discussed standard vs trial treatment options
Reviewed potential benefits and additional requirements of trial participation

cancer_timeline.value: Diagnostic imaging shows 7.2cm left breast mass with multiple abnormal axillary nodes
Core biopsy left breast and axillary nodes
Core biopsy confirms micropapillary carcinoma, AR and GATA3 positive with TILs 60%
Staging CT and bone scan show no evidence of metastatic disease
Registered for IMPACT-BC trial investigating intensified neoadjuvant chemotherapy

status_updates.value: Newly diagnosed locally advanced left breast micropapillary carcinoma. Registered for neoadjuvant chemotherapy trial after confirming eligibility.
Baseline cardiac MRI scheduled 22 Apr 2024, Research tissue collection 25 Apr 2024
Trial randomisation 26 Apr 2024, Chemotherapy teaching 29 Apr 2024, First treatment scheduled 2 May 2024
